articles.headline: Meager Living of Haitians Is Wiped Out by Storms
articles.snippet: The resolve of the people of Gonaïves, Haiti, is being tested by a string of tropical storms and hurricanes.
articles.abstract: The resolve of the people of Gonaïves, Haiti, is being tested by a string of tropical storms and hurricanes.
articles.lead_paragraph: GONAÏVES, Haiti — Their cupboards were virtually bare before the winds started whipping, the skies opened up and this seaside city filled like a caldron with thick, brown, smelly muck.

articles.headline: Washington Mutual Stock Falls on Investor Fears
articles.snippet: As Wall Street scoured the financial industry for the next weakest link after Lehman Brothers, it set its sights on a familiar target: Washington Mutual.
articles.abstract: As Wall Street scoured the financial industry for the next weakest link after Lehman Brothers, it set its sights on a familiar target: Washington Mutual.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Wall Street scoured the financial industry Wednesday for the next weakest link after Lehman Brothers, it set its sights on a familiar target: Washington Mutual, the nation’s largest savings and loan.
articles.byline: By Eric Dash and Geraldine Fabrikant

articles.headline: Nontechies, This One’s for You
articles.snippet: Make way for the Peek, a pocket-size item that is aimed at the world’s nontechnical population.
articles.abstract: Make way for the Peek, a pocket-size item that is aimed at the world’s nontechnical population.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are two kinds of people in the world: those who divide the world into two kinds of people, and those who don’t.

articles.headline: Real Estate Woes Spread to China
articles.snippet: Real estate brokers say prices in China are down from peaks reached earlier this year, while the number of transactions has plunged.
articles.abstract: Real estate brokers say prices in China are down from peaks reached earlier this year, while the number of transactions has plunged.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China  China has joined the United States, Britain, Spain and others on the list of nations suffering a real estate decline.

articles.headline: Saudis Vow to Ignore OPEC Decision to Cut Production
articles.snippet: Saudi officials assured world markets that they would continue to pump as much oil as needed.
articles.abstract: Saudi officials assured world markets that they would continue to pump as much oil as needed.
articles.lead_paragraph: VIENNA  Hours after suffering a rare setback in a negotiating session at OPEC’s headquarters, Saudi Arabian officials assured world markets on Wednesday that they would ignore the wishes of other cartel members and continue to pump plenty of oil.

articles.headline: Palin’s Pipeline Is Years From Being a Reality
articles.snippet: In talking about a pipeline deal that is the centerpiece of her record, Gov. Sarah Palin has overstated its progress.
articles.abstract: In talking about a pipeline deal that is the centerpiece of her record, Gov. Sarah Palin has overstated its progress.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANCHORAGE  When Gov. Sarah Palin of Alaska took center stage at the Republican convention last week, she sought to burnish her executive credentials by telling how she had engineered the deal that jump-started a long-delayed gas pipeline project.
articles.byline: By Serge F. Kovaleski and Mike McIntire

articles.headline: Sex, Drug Use and Graft Cited in Interior Department
articles.snippet: The Interior Department agency that collects oil and gas royalties has been caught up in a broad ethics scandal.
articles.abstract: The Interior Department agency that collects oil and gas royalties has been caught up in a broad ethics scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As Congress prepares to debate expansion of drilling in taxpayer-owned coastal waters, the Interior Department agency that collects oil and gas royalties has been caught up in a wide-ranging ethics scandal  including allegations of financial self-dealing, accepting gifts from energy companies, cocaine use and sexual misconduct.

articles.headline: Tough Fight for Chief at Lehman
articles.snippet: Richard S. Fuld Jr., chief of Lehman Brothers for the last decade and a half, is trying to save an institution mired in the throes of flagging confidence.
articles.abstract: Richard S. Fuld Jr., chief of Lehman Brothers for the last decade and a half, is trying to save an institution mired in the throes of flagging confidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard S. Fuld Jr. was fed up being Wall Street’s punching bag.
